Title: Andersonville
Descriptive Text: Andersonville, located in the southwest corner of the Edgewater Community Area, began as a Swedish community. In the late 1980s Andersonville became an attractive area of settlement for gays and lesbians who sought cheaper homes and apartments north of Boys Town.
Bibliography: Pacyga, Dominic A., and Ellen Skerrett. Chicago, City of Neighborhoods: Histories and Tours. 1986. Stuyvesant, Judith Erickson. “Recollections of Andersonville and Swedish Life in Chicago.” Collections of the Swedish American Museum, Chicago, IL. 1997.
Hyperlinked Terms Associated: Edgewater| Swedish| gays and lesbians| Boys Town
